snippet: Thousands of gas stations have closed in the last 20 years, leaving vacant properties at busy corners that can be attractive locations for new businesses.
abstract: More than 50,000 gas stations have closed in the last two decades, leaving many communities saddled with vacant or abandoned lots; properties can be attractive locations for new businesses; converting these sites can be challenging, as they often are on small lots and may be contaminated by petroleum leaking from underground storage tanks.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of gas stations have closed in the last 20 years, leaving vacant properties at busy corners that can be attractive locations for new businesses.

headline.seo: A Clean New Life for Grimy Gas Stations
headline.main: A Clean New Life for Grimy Gas Stations
headline.print_headline: A Clean New Life for Grimy Gas Stations
